content.text: Describe the motion of the bus between each of the bus stops. Select the appropriate description from the list below
**constant acceleration** **decreasing acceleration**
**increasing acceleration** **moving backwards at constant speed**
**moving forwards at constant speed** **stationary**
1. between A and B
2. between B and C
3. between C and D
The average speed of the bus between A and D is \(23 \text{km / h}\)
Calculate the distance between A and D
distance =
The bus stops at D for 1 min and then travels at a constant acceleration for 30 seconds
On Fig. 1.1, sketch a possible graph for this additional motion. Label X when the bus starts to accelerate and label Y for 30 seconds later
A bus is travelling between points A and D. There are bus stops at A, B, C and D but the bus does not stop at B and C. Fig. 1.1 is a speed-time graph for the bus
Calculate the change in momentum of the water that is ejected in 6.0 s
momentum =   .........
Calculate the magnitude of the force acting on the model because of the jet of water
The brakes of the model are released
State and explain the direction of the acceleration of the model
Statement
Explanation
In (c) the model contains a water tank, which is initially full
State and explain any change in the magnitude of the initial acceleration if the brakes are first released when the tank is nearly empty
Statement
Explanation
Fig. 2.1 shows a model fire engine. Its brakes are applied
0.80 kg of water is emitted in the jet every 6.0 s at a velocity of \(0.72 \text{m / s}\) relative to the model
State the main form of energy transferred from the Sun to the solar cells for the generation of electrical energy
State **one** environmental advantage and **one** environmental disadvantage
advantage
disadvantage
State and explain whether this source of electrical energy is renewable
Consider the generation of electrical energy by a large number of solar cells, as shown in Fig. 3.1

Each group of solar cells is arranged in a rectangle \(1.2\mathrm{m}\times 2.8\mathrm{m}.\) The solar cells are situated in a region where \(260\mathrm{W}\) of solar energy is received per square metre of the cells. The electrical output of each group of solar cells is a current of \(2.5\mathrm{A}\) with a potential difference of \(86\mathrm{V.}\)
Calculate the efficiency of the solar cells
efficiency =   .........  %
Fig. 3.1 shows solar cells used to generate electrical energy
Fig. 3.1
State and explain, in terms of molecules, any change in the pressure of a gas when the volume is reduced at a constant temperature
Statement
Explanation
Complete Table 4.1 to give the relative order of magnitude of the expansion of gases, liquids and solids for the same increase of temperature
Write one of these words in each blank space:
A liquid is heated so that bubbles of its vapour rise to the surface and molecules escape to the atmosphere
State the name of this process
At a lower temperature than in (a)(i), molecules escape from the surface to the atmosphere
State the name of this process
Fig. 5.1 shows apparatus used to determine the power output of a heater
The metal block has a mass of \(2.7 \text{kg}\). The metal of the block has a specific heat capacity of \(900 \text{J} / (\text{kg} \circ \text{C})\)
In 2 min 30 s, the temperature of the block increases from \(21^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) to \(39^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\)
Calculate the power of the heater
power =
State and explain a precaution that can be taken to improve the accuracy of the experiment
Statement
Explanation
State the name of the process that occurs as the wave moves from region A to region B
Suggest a cause for the change in direction of the wave
Fig. 6.1 shows a water wave in a ripple tank
Fig. 6.2 shows a transverse wave
On Fig. 6.2, draw a wave which has half the amplitude and a greater frequency than the wave shown
Explain why this happens
The speed of sound in the rails is \(5800 \text{m/s}\)
Calculate the wavelength of sound of frequency \(1100 \text{Hz}\) travelling at this speed
wavelength =
A train travels along steel rails. A person waiting at a station hears the sound of the train through the rails before he hears the sound through the air
In Fig. 7.1, a converging lens projects a sharp image of an object O on to a screen
Complete the paths of the two rays from the object to the screen
Fig. 7.1

The converging lens in (a) is replaced with a thinner converging lens. The object O and the screen remain in the same positions as in (a). The thinner converging lens has a longer focal length than the converging lens in (a)
Complete the paths of the two rays from the object to the screen in Fig. 7.2
Fig. 7.2
Describe the position of the object in relation to the lens
Describe the position of the image in relation to the lens and the object
Give three properties of the image formed by a magnifying glass
A converging lens is used as a magnifying glass
The focal length of the lens is \(10 \text{cm}\)

Complete Table 8.1 for the input values shown
Describe how to demagnetise a bar magnet using alternating current (a.c.) in a coil
Explain the purpose of the split-ring commutator
The voltage of the power supply is increased
State the effect this has on the motor
Fig. 9.1 shows a simple direct current (d.c.) motor
Calculate the combined resistance of the lamp and the two resistors
resistance =   .........
The potential difference (p.d.) of the supply is increased so that the current in the lamp increases
State and explain any change in the resistance of the lamp
Statement
Explanation
Fig. 10.1 shows a circuit containing a filament lamp of resistance \(0.30 \Omega\) and two resistors, each of resistance \(0.20 \Omega\)

A radon-222 nucleus contains 86 protons and 136 neutrons. It decays by emitting an \(\alpha\) -particle and becomes a nucleus of an isotope of polonium. The symbol for radon is Rn and the symbol for polonium is Po
Write down the nuclide equation for this decay

Carbon-14 is radioactive with a half-life of 5700 years. An animal bone is dug up in an archaeological excavation. The quantity of carbon-14 in the bone is \(25\%\) of what it was when the bone was buried
Calculate the time that has elapsed since it was buried
time =   .........  years
